modName: AIMP - Antz in my Pantz - Interactive Edition -
summary: This mod adds over 1100 hand-placed animated ant tiles all over Skyrim. That's more than 150 times as many as vanilla! As a bonus, I've made the ants harvestable, added 7 new ingredients, fixed a number of glitches, created 6 high-res photorealistic ant species, and even a species of centipede! The ants go away at night and in bad w
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338557112.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338473285.png[/img][/center]
[size=7][color=red] [center]AIMP: Antz in my Pantz[/center] [/color][/size]
[size=5][color=orange][center]-= Interactive Edition =-[/center][/color][/size]
[center][size=3]by [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=3463396#]steve40[/URL][/center][/size]

[center][size=2][i]"I've got [URL=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZeZcJhAehRU]antz in my pantz[/URL] and I need to dance...ooowwww" - James Brown playing Skyrim :)[/center][/size][/i]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338473431.png[/img][/center]

[img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-2-1347548439.png[/img][color=white][size=3][URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25379]Click here for Russian version[/URL][/color][/size]

[size=5][color=red]Description[/size][/color]

[color=white][size=3]The vanilla ants are low res, badly drawn, oversized and underutilized. This mod adds [/color][/size][size=3][color=yellow]over 1100 hand-placed animated ant tiles[/color][/size][size=3][color=white] all over Skyrim! [/color][/size][size=3][color=yellow]That's more than 150 times as many as vanilla.[/color][/size][size=3][color=white] As a bonus, I've added special enhancements (such as making the ants [/color][/size][size=3][color=yellow]interactive and harvestable[/color][/size][size=3][color=white]), fixed a number of glitches, created six new high-res photorealistic ant species, and even a species of centipede, and added 7 new alchemy ingredients.

Q: Skyrim has ants? I didn't know that!
A: Yes, Skyrim has ants, but only 9 ant tiles in the whole game.

Q: Your mod adds a lot of ants. Does this mod give a performance hit?
A: No, there is zero performance hit with this mod. The ants are simply scrolling textures. The maximum number of ant tiles used per cell is about 6, but typically only 2-3. Only a small number of ant tiles will be loaded in memory at one time, and they unload from memory after the player moves out of the area.

Q: Can the ants be interacted with or used for alchemy?
A: Yes!
[/size][/color]

[center][youtube]XEP0CE6s4KA[/youtube][/center]
[center][color=white][size=3]V1.0 featured in Skyrim Mods Weekly: Bits 'n' Bobs #13 (see 4:08)[/color][/size][/center]

[center][color=white][size=3]Featured at [URL=http://skyrimbox.blog.fc2.com/blog-entry-431.html]SkyrimBox[/URL] (Japanese)[/color][/size][/center]

[center][color=white][size=3]Featured at [URL=http://skyrim.2game.info/detail.php?id=18855]Skyrim Mod[/URL] (Japanese)[/color][/size][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-4-1338473287.png[/img][/center]

[center][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://SkyrimGEMS.com/images/badge_animated.gif[/img][/url][/center]

[size=5][center]Featured in [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11]STEP - Skyrim Total Enhancement Project[/url][/center][/size]

[size=5][color=red]Change Log[/size][/color]

[color=white][size=3]Version v2.03
[list][*] Fixed a collision issue that was causing clutter on stumps that had ants to float above the stump surface.
[*] Removed two ant tiles from stumps in cell [-3,-17] that were causing issues in the Hearthfire DLC Lakeview Manor player home location.
[/list][/size][/color]
[color=white][size=3]Version v2.02
[list][*] Fixed the collision shape on the flat centipede tiles.
[*] Fixed the “AIMPIngScript.psc” errors that mysteriously appeared in the Papyrus log when harvesting ants, after the TES5EDIT cleaning process. I had to delete and re-add the script in the CK.
[/list][/size][/color]
[color=white][size=3]Version v2.01
[list][*] Removed a misplaced ant tile in Dawnstar iron mine.
[*] Cleaned the mod with TES5EDIT, 12 records removed.
[/list][/size][/color]
[color=white][size=3]Version v2.0
[list][*] Ants and centipedes are now interactive.
[*] Ants and centipedes can be harvested for alchemy ingredients.
[*] Created 7 new alchemy ingredients.
[*] Cleaned up some UDRs (even though they were harmless).
[/list][/size][/color]
[color=white][size=3]Version v1.1
[list][*] The centipedes have been improved. They now move more slowly and there are much fewer centipedes per tile (thanks to weijiesen).
[*] Two normal maps were reformatted to make their file size smaller.
[*] The script has been improved even further to minimize the occurrence of runtime errors when the parent cells unload.
[*] The bsa archive was compressed to make the mod file size smaller.
[/list][/size][/color]
[color=white][size=3]Version v1.01
[list][*]Fixed a Papyrus runtime warning message that was spamming the debug log.
[*]Fixed some CK errors that were caused by doing a search-replace on several references.
[/list][/size][/color]
[size=5][color=red]Six New Ant Species Plus Bonus Centipedes[/size][/color]

[color=white][size=3]The new ant textures are based on photos of real ants and have a resolution of 256x1024 (vanilla is 64x256).[/size][/color]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338617685.png[/img][/center]

[size=5][color=red]Where to Find Them[/size][/color]

[color=white][size=3]Want to find some ants quickly? Try looking around Riverwood, especially near the bridge.

You will find ants (or more rarely, centipedes) near most rotten logs, old tree stumps, sawn-off stumps and large wood piles all over Skyrim (maybe even in a few indoor locations), mostly in the warmer areas. You generally won't find any ants in the cold snowy regions. And of course, you won't see ants at night or in bad weather.

[list]
[*]Sawn tree stumps
[*]Piles of firewood
[*]Old tree stumps
[*]Dead trees
[*]Old aspen and pine logs
[*]Crawling up the sides of old shacks, cabins and huts
[*]Wood chopping blocks
[*]Log piles
[*]Hay bales
[*]Piles of leaves (at Riften)
[/size][/color][/list]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338474132.png[/img][/center]
[size=5][color=red]Extra[/size][/color]
[LIST]
[*][color=white][size=3] The ants and centipedes can now be harvested for alchemy ingredients by "squashing" them. Just find the "Squash Ant" sweet spot and press the "E" key. Ingredients will regenerate when the cell resets (usually every 31 game days). Note that if you drop any of the AIMP ingredients from your inventory they will be destroyed. [/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] Seven new alchemy ingredients have been created.[/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] The ants and centipedes can be destroyed using various forms of attack. You may need to hit the "sweet spot" to get this feature to work. They will return again when the cell reloads.[/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] The ants and centipedes are scripted to stay in their nests after dark or when it is raining or snowing![/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] I've added subtle insect-crawling sounds to the ants to make them a bit more interesting. The sfx volume is very low so that it won't be distracting or unrealistic.[/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] Bethesda made a glowmap for their ants but forgot to add it to their mesh. I've created my own glowmaps and implemented them via TextureSets.[/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] Bethesda's vanilla ant mesh was not UV mapped correctly, which caused many of the ants to be truncated in half. I've adjusted the mesh and UV mapping to minimize this problem.[/size][/color]
[*][color=white][size=3] Bethesda's ants were way too big. I've reduced their size by 50% and doubled the number of ant lines.[/size][/color][/LIST]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-3-1338470702.png[/img][/center]
[size=5][color=red]Compatibility[/size][/color]

[color=white][size=3]This mod is fully compatible with [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4955]101 BugsHD by 83Willows[/URL] and [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17168]Skyrim Bigger Trees by Xweto[/URL].
[/size][/color]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-2-1338469726.png[/img][/center]
[size=5][color=red]Installation[/size][/color]

[color=white][size=3]Just copy the "AIMP - Antz in my Pantz.esp" and "AIMP - Antz in my Pantz.bsa" files to your Skyrim DATA folder and activate the esp file. If the mod is active you should see a brief on-screen message after your game loads. To disable the mod, simply uncheck "AIMP - Antz in my Pantz.esp" in the Data section of the Skyrim Launcher. To uninstall it completely, simply delete "AIMP - Antz in my Pantz.esp" and "AIMP - Antz in my Pantz.bsa" from your Skyrim DATA folder.

If you have any problem with ants not appearing in your game then do the following:

Use console to "coc qasmoke" then save game.
Quit the game and deactivate AIMP.
Restart game and load last save. Save game again.
Quit game and reactivate AIMP.
Restart game and load last save.
Use console to "coc riverwood".
[/size][/color]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338472095.png[/img][/center]

[size=5][color=red]Screenshots[/size][/color]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1348490207.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1339836085.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-5-1339821587.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-4-1339821586.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1339821582.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-1-1338471015.png[/img][/center]
[size=5][color=red]Credits[/size][/color]
[color=white][size=3]
Many thanks to weijiesen for the improved centipedes for v1.1

Thanks to Neovalen for help fixing a collision problem on the tree stumps.

Thanks to the many Nexus users who have provided helpful feedback.

This mod took several weeks and many late nights to develop. If you would like to provide feedback of any kind, please use the commenting system. Thank You.[/color][/size]

[center][img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/110/mods/images/14718-2-1338474133.png[/img][/center]

Fixed the collision shape on the flat centipede tiles.
Fixed the “AIMPIngScript.psc” errors that mysteriously appeared after cleaning with TES5EDIT.

Fixed a collision issue that was causing clutter on stumps that had ants to float above the stump surface.
Removed two ant tiles from stumps in cell [-3,-17] that were causing issues in the Hearthfire DLC Lakeview Manor player home location.
